{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3498066,"name":"Michael","username":"Mike_739","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_739/{size}/251101_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T18:13:06.505Z","cooked":"

I was looking at different options for bumper mounting and I thought about putting these in the corners to mount the bumper

mcmaster.com

McMaster-Carr

McMaster-Carr is the complete source for your plant with over 595,000 products. 98% of products ordered ship from stock and deliver same or next day.

Below is my idea for using these (sorry about the drawing)

IMG_76391097×1031 98.5 KB

Would this be a decent way of keeping the bumpers secure on a robot? I was also considering putting L-channels in the middle of the bumpers also using the bolt idea.

*Clarification: it will be a bumper that goes fully around the frame in one piece

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T18:46:57.150Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":16,"reads":167,"readers_count":166,"score":118.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484490,"topic_slug":"another-bumper-question-corner-mounting","display_username":"Michael","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.mcmaster.com/products/corner-brackets/corner-reinforcing-brackets/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"McMaster-Carr","clicks":8}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64489,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/another-bumper-question-corner-mounting/484490/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3498071,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T18:20:43.612Z","cooked":"

According to me, That would be a legal bumper attachment. Or least that by itself is legal. Using a #10 screw to attach the bumper to the robot is a little marginal. The bumper needs to be securely attached to the robot. That is a little bit of a judgment call. If the center of the bumper seems insecure you might be asked to make it more secure. Remember the LRI at the event is the final judge on these things.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T18:20:43.612Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":150,"readers_count":149,"score":40.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484490,"topic_slug":"another-bumper-question-corner-mounting","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/another-bumper-question-corner-mounting/484490/2","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3498094,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T18:38:32.256Z","cooked":"

Legal? Sure. Good? Meh, depends on your priorities. This will be easy to build, tolerant of errors in the frame dimension, and if predictions that reefscape will be a low contact game are correct, this will be plenty protective. However in a game with lots of high speed collisions like 2023 or 2024, I’d avoid corner bumpers because they create a break in the middle of each side of the robot where the robot frame is most susceptible to bending.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T18:38:32.256Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":130,"readers_count":129,"score":36.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484490,"topic_slug":"another-bumper-question-corner-mounting","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/another-bumper-question-corner-mounting/484490/3","custom_user_title":"Build mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3498113,"name":"Ian Saam","username":"Enjsnake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/enjsnake/{size}/201559_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T18:44:56.312Z","cooked":"

There’s a difference between corner mounting and 4 piece corner bumpers, I agree that bumpers only in the corners are a bad idea but mounting in just the corners is perfectly fine.

OP, we’ve been mounting our bumpers just in the corners for 2 years now and will be doing the same this year, they’ve worked great. I described our mounting solution here:

Bumper and Lifting Eye Mount Design for Mk4i/n Swerve Modules Manufacturing
We’ve been doing something similar these past two years, and feel pretty good about what we came up with. This is what we used in 2023: [IMG_3539], just sitting on top of a 3d print we put around the edge of the module. Unlike your design, we didn’t bend the plates and had the screws holding the bracket onto the wood back out repeatedly. This year, we got a couple bent plates from fabworks that only attached the the very corner bolt of the module(still on a slight 0.25 plate riser): [IMG_5063…

If I put the brackets in the center of the bumpers as well to secure the bumpers towards the middle areas would it be good for higher contact games?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T18:45:31.323Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":96,"readers_count":95,"score":24.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484490,"topic_slug":"another-bumper-question-corner-mounting","display_username":"Michael","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":52597,"username":"Patrick3357","name":"Patrick","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64489,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/another-bumper-question-corner-mounting/484490/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3498120,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T18:50:26.286Z","cooked":"

Fair point, I was assuming corner bumpers for no particular reason. I’d definitely endorse this construction on a full single piece bumper.

Mike_739:

If I put the brackets in the center of the bumpers as well to secure the bumpers towards the middle areas would it be good for higher contact games?

The trouble with corner bumpers is that the backing has a cut in the middle of each side, so the backer is not providing any additional strength to the frame.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T18:52:58.503Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":21.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":484490,"topic_slug":"another-bumper-question-corner-mounting","display_username":"Michael","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64489,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/another-bumper-question-corner-mounting/484490/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3498139,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T19:04:14.628Z","cooked":"

For what it is worth we have used this on bumpers in the past (triangle bracket in the corner). Works well on 1 piece bumpers that are a rectangle. Does not work well on C shaped bumpers… You need the extra attachment points.

The box joint (finger joint) in the corner with the polywood is the correct call imo.

You may need to shim the frame or bumpers with thin polycarb to get the fit right to not wreck the fastners. Be sure to use high quality fastners in the corners so they don’t break or wreck what they are threaded into (e.g. rivnuts)

Do you think 2x2 inch brackets like these on all four corners would be sufficient to support a bumper?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T17:19:17.169Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":52,"readers_count":51,"score":15.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484490,"topic_slug":"another-bumper-question-corner-mounting","display_username":"Michael","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.mcmaster.com/1088A31/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"McMaster-Carr","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64489,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/another-bumper-question-corner-mounting/484490/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3500783,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T17:23:01.156Z","cooked":"

Support? Yes. However you will need to be careful on how to safely lift the bot.

You will need to ensure that they are not the only thing holding the bumper together. The box/finger joint in your sketch does a good job holding it together.

Beware of fabric thickness and whatnot, you will likely want to make you backing 1/8" oversized vs the robot perimeter.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-03T17:23:53.145Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":15.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484490,"topic_slug":"another-bumper-question-corner-mounting","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64489,"username":"Mike_739","name":"Michael","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_739/{size}/251101_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/another-bumper-question-corner-mounting/484490/11","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3500790,"name":"Michael","username":"Mike_739","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_739/{size}/251101_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-03T17:26:21.673Z","cooked":"

Would these + L-channels be sufficient to hold the bumper on the robot in higher impact games too?
